definition.en: Enlarged pores are small openings in the skin that appear larger than normal due to excess oil production, loss of skin elasticity, sun damage, or genetics. They are most visible on the T-zone (nose, forehead, chin).
definition.th: รูขุมขนกว้าง คือช่องเปิดเล็กๆ บนผิวหนังที่ดูใหญ่กว่าปกติเนื่องจากการผลิตน้ำมันมากเกินไป การสูญเสียความยืดหยุ่นของผิว ความเสียหายจากแดด หรือพันธุกรรม มักเห็นได้ชัดในโซนที (จมูก หน้าผาก คาง)

causes: Loss of skin elasticity with age
prevention: Cleanse face twice daily with salicylic acid cleanser
Don't pick at skin or squeeze pores

mild.description: Slightly visible pores, mainly on nose and central face

moderate.description: Noticeable pores across T-zone, oily skin, visible from distance

severe.description: Very large pores, visible without magnification, orange-peel texture

whenToSeeDermatologist: Pores don't improve with OTC treatments after 3 months
Accompanied by severe acne or blackheads

statistics.genetics: Pore size is 50% determined by genetics
statistics.men: Men typically have larger pores than women
statistics.age: Pores appear larger with age due to loss of collagen

myths.fact: Pore size is largely genetic. Treatments can minimize appearance temporarily, but pores cannot permanently close.

myths.myth: Hot water opens pores, cold water closes them
myths.fact: Pores don't have muscles and can't open or close. Temperature affects blood flow and oil consistency, not pore size.
Pore strips only remove surface sebum. Blackheads return quickly without proper cleansing and exfoliation.
Makeup doesn't enlarge pores, but not removing it properly can clog pores and make them appear larger.

mostEffective: Fractional CO2 laser - stimulates collagen, tightens pores
Microneedling with RF - improves texture and pore size
Chemical peels - deep exfoliation and skin renewal
professionalTreatments.sessions: Multiple sessions needed for best results (3-6 treatments)
